app.framework

Class Controller<M extends Model,V extends View>

  • java.lang.Object
    • app.framework.Controller<M,V>
  • Type Parameters:
    M - The type of model that the controller will operate on.
    V - The type of view that the controller will operate on.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TodoController

    public abstract class Controller<M extends Model,V extends View>
extends java.lang.Object
    The Controller class describes all the basic functionality of a controller within the MVC architecture.

    From Wikipedia:

    A controller can send commands to the model to update the model's state (e.g., editing a document). It can also send commands to its associated view to change the view's presentation of the model (e.g., by scrolling through a document).
    See Also:
    http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Model%E2%80%93view%E2%80%93controller

        Parameters:

        consumer - The Consumer to attach to the specified event.
